p.s: I really liked the film The Hate U Give because it concentrates on many important aspects of teenage life such as love, friendship, family, personality etc.
In some situations you can emphasize with the maincharactermain character Starr for example combining family life and friends.
It also shows the character development of Starr and you can see her journey from a girl who does not know who she is to a strong and brave joungyoung woman.
This showed me the importance of raising your voice when someone does you wrong.
It also highlights the process of finding yourself and what is really important to you, for example that you have to realize if someone is not good for you.
In the movie Starr needed to let Hailey go to develop her character.
The importance of the family is also foreshadowed which I think is also something that most teenagers often forget.
Of course this is the age where you get independent but a healthy and loving family is something that I think everybody still needs.
All in all the film puctures the challenges of teenage life really good because of the difficulties that Starr has to overcome.
